sen.j: 大葬（たいそう）とは、天皇・皇后ら三后の葬儀のこと。
sen.e: Taiso means imperial funeral of an emperor, empress, grand empress dowager, empress dowager and empress consort.
Taiso means imperial funeral of an emperor, empress, grand empress dowager, empress dowager and empress consort.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Taiso means imperial funeral of an emperor, empress, grand empress dowager, empress dowager and empress consort.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 近代の宮中祭祀および関連法令においては、「大喪」と表記されている。
sen.e: Modern court ritual and related act describe it as 'taiso (imperial mourning).'
Modern court ritual and related acts describe it as 'taiso (imperial mourning).'
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Modern court ritual and related acts describe it as 'taiso (imperial mourning).'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 古代においては、殯宮を設置して1年間遺体を安置する慣わしであった。
sen.e: It was an ancient tradition to build a hinkyu (funeral parlor) to enshrine the deceased for a year.
It was an ancient tradition to build a hinkyu (funeral parlor) to enshrine the deceased for a year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It was an ancient tradition to build a hinkyu (temporary imperial mortuary) to enshrine the remains of the deceased for one year.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 持統天皇の時に火葬が導入されて以後は簡略化されて30日間が通例とされた。
sen.e: The Emperor Jito was the first to be cremated; Since then, the procedure was simplified and the deceased was enshrined only for 30 days.
sen.cmt: 「簡略化されて」は「（儀式の）方式が簡略化されて」の意味に解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: The Emperor Jito was the first to be cremated; Since then, the procedure was simplified and the deceased was enshrined only for 30 days.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After the cremation was introduced when Emperor Jito passed away, the procedure was simplified and the ordinary enshrinement period became 30 days.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 聖武天皇の時に仏教に則った方式に変更された。
sen.e: The procedure was changed to conform to Buddhism at the funeral of Emperor Shomu.
The procedure was changed to conform to Buddhism at the funeral of Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The procedure was changed to conform to Buddhism at the funeral of Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平安時代以後は、生前に造営した寺院などで行う事になった。
sen.e: Since the Heian Period, taiso had been held at a temple that he or she built while alive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since the Heian Period, taiso had been held at a temple that he or she had built while alive.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Since the Heian period, a taiso had been held at a temple that he or she had built before he or she had passed away.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 北朝 (日本)の後光厳天皇以後は京都泉涌寺で開催されることとなった。
sen.e: Kyoto Nyusen-ji Temple became the venue after Emperor Gokogon of the Northern Court (Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kyoto Nyusen-ji Temple became the venue after Emperor Gokogon of the Northern Court (Japan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Sennyu-ji Temple in Kyoto became a venue for a taiso after the time of Emperor Gokogon of the Northern Court (Japan).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代の後光明天皇以後は様式は火葬のまま、実際には土葬の制が復活した。
sen.e: Doso no sei (imperial command of burial) was restored while maintaining the cremation style after Emperor Gokomyo of the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Doso no sei (imperial command of burial) was restored while maintaining the cremation style after Emperor Gokomyo of the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Doso no sei (imperial command of burial) was restored while maintaining the cremation style after Emperor Gokomyo of the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 孝明天皇の時に様式も土葬のそれとなった。
sen.e: Emperor Komei was also buried in line with the style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Emperor Komei was also buried in line with the style.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The ceremony style was also changed in line with the burial style in the time of Emperor Komei.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: なお、この時までは仏教による葬儀であった。
sen.e: Until then, the funeral rites had conformed to Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Until then, the funeral rites had conformed to Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Until then, the funeral rites had conformed to Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、明治維新と東京奠都の影響により、その3年祭は東京に移された宮中で神道に則って開催された。
sen.e: After the Maiji Restoration and Tokyo Tento (transfer of the national capital to Tokyo), the third anniversary was held at the Imperial court that was transferred to Tokyo; the rites conformed to Shinto religion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Maiji Restoration and Tokyo Tento (transfer of the national capital to Tokyo), the third anniversary was held at the Imperial court that was transferred to Tokyo; the rites conformed to Shinto religion.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: As a result of the Meiji Restoration and the relocation of the capital to Tokyo, however, Sannen-sai Festival (a ceremony held three years after an emperor's death) for this emperor was held at the Imperial Court, which had been transferred to Tokyo by that time, according to Shinto rules.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 以後、英照皇太后と明治天皇の神式の例を踏まえて、1909年に皇室服喪令、続いて1924年に皇室喪儀令が制定された。
sen.e: Regulation over which imperial family mourns the passing for certain time (1909) and koshitsusogi no rei (1924) were enacted based on the Shinto rites used for Empress Dowager Eisho and Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Regulation over which imperial family mourns the passing for a certain time (1909) and koshitsusogi no rei (1924) were enacted based on the Shinto rites used for Empress Dowager Eisho and Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Based on the Shinto ceremonies for Empress Dowager Eisho and Emperor Meiji, the Imperial ordinance of mourning was enacted in 1909, and then the Imperial ordinance of funeral rites was established in 1924.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 天皇及び三后の逝去を「崩御」・葬儀を「大喪」と呼称する事が定められた。
sen.e: The laws stipulated that 'hogyo (demise)' refers to the death of an emperor as well as grand empress dowager, empress dowager and empress consort; and that 'taiso' refers to their funeral.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The laws stipulated that 'hogyo (demise)' refers to the death of an emperor as well as grand empress dowager, empress dowager and empress consort; and that 'taiso' refers to their funeral.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The ordinances stipulated that the term 'hogyo' (demise) referred to the death of an emperor, a grand empress dowager, an empress dowager, and an empress consort, and the term 'taiso' referred to their funerals.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 戦後の皇室典範改正により、皇室服喪令・皇室喪儀令は廃された。
sen.e: Imperial House Act was revised after the war, and both the regulation over which imperial family mourns the passing for certain time and koshitsusogi no rei were abolished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Imperial House Act was revised after the war, and both the regulations over which imperial family mourns the passing for a certain time and koshitsusogi no rei were abolished.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Both the Imperial ordinance of mourning and the Imperial ordinance of funeral rites were abolished due to the revision of the Imperial Household Law after the war.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、慣例としてこれに準じた儀礼が採用された。
sen.e: However, the rites based on the former regulations were adopted as customary.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the rites based on the former regulations were adopted as customary.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, rites based on these ordinances were adopted as customary practices.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 1989年の昭和天皇の場合には、日本国憲法の政教分離原則に反しない形で国家儀式の大喪の礼と皇室儀式の葬場殿の儀・斂葬の儀が分離された。
sen.e: When Emperor Showa demised in 1989, the Rites of an Imperial Funeral (held as a national ceremony) was separated from sojoden-no-gi and the Ceremony of Interment (held as Imperial ceremonies) to comply with the principle of separation of government and religion according to the Constitution of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Emperor Showa passed away in 1989, the Rites of an Imperial Funeral (held as a national ceremony) were separated from sojoden-no-gi and the Ceremony of Interment (held as an Imperial ceremony) to comply with the principle of separation of government and religion according to the Constitution of Japan.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: When Emperor Showa passed away in 1989, the national ceremony called Taiso no Rei (the Rites of an Imperial Funeral) was held separately from the Imperial Family's ceremonies called Sojoden no Gi and Renso no Gi in order to comply with the principle of the separation of politics and religion according to the Constitution of Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 実際には連続して開催されている。
sen.e: In fact, the ceremonies were held sequentially.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In fact, the ceremonies were held sequentially.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In fact, the ceremonies were held sequentially.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
